info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 2:07PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Yuma, Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 245 PM MST... At 206 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a group of strong thunderstorms south of I-8, moving west at 10-20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hazards to motorists due to blowing dust causing reduced visibility and strong winds causing difficult handling conditions. Locations impacted include... Gila Bend, Maricopa, Kaka, Freeman, Dateland, Sonoran National Monument, Mohawk, Mobile and Ak-Chin Village. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 49 and 155. AZ Route 238 between mile markers 1 and 43. AZ Route 85 between mile markers 1 and 136. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
